docs.snippet: A student who was slammed to the floor by a police officer in a North Carolina high school has suffered a concussion and may have other related health issues, her attorney said Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A student who was slammed to the floor by a police officer in a North Carolina high school has suffered a concussion and may have other related health issues, her attorney said Thursday.

headline.main: Attorney: Student Slammed to Floor Suffered Concussion
headline.print_headline: Attorney: Student Slammed to Floor Suffered Concussion

docs.snippet: The number of foreign tourists visiting Thailand rose nearly 9 percent to 32.6 million in 2016, bringing in 1.64 trillion baht ($45.9 billion) worth of business, up nearly 13 percent from 2015, according to data released by the Tourism Ministry on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of foreign tourists visiting Thailand rose nearly 9 percent to 32.6 million in 2016, bringing in 1.64 trillion baht ($45.9 billion) worth of business, up nearly 13 percent from 2015, according to data released by the Tourism Ministry on Thursday.

headline.main: Thailand Tourist Numbers Rise Nearly Nine Percent in 2016
headline.print_headline: Thailand Tourist Numbers Rise Nearly Nine Percent in 2016

docs.snippet: The country is making an effort to build, expand and renovate 100,000 toilets in scenic areas and along tourist routes....
docs.lead_paragraph: The country is making an effort to build, expand and renovate 100,000 toilets in scenic areas and along tourist routes.

headline.main: China Rates the Best Toilets for Tourists (and Tells the Laggards to Clean Up)

byline.contributor: Mike Ives reported from Hong Kong, and Ryan McMorrow contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By MIKE IVES and RYAN MCMORROW

docs.snippet: The ASB Tennis Classic was shorn of the last of its big-name contenders on Thursday when former world No.1 Caroline Wozniacki wasted a match-winning position and lost 1-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the quarterfinals to Germany's Julia Goerges....
docs.lead_paragraph: The ASB Tennis Classic was shorn of the last of its big-name contenders on Thursday when former world No.1 Caroline Wozniacki wasted a match-winning position and lost 1-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the quarterfinals to Germany's Julia Goerges.

headline.main: Wozniacki Beaten in ASB Classic Quarterfinals
headline.print_headline: Wozniacki Beaten in ASB Classic Quarterfinals

docs.snippet: The presidents of Toyota Motor Corp and Honda Motor Co Ltd said they have no immediate plans to curb production in Mexico, preferring to wait until after Donald Trump's inauguration as U.S. President this month before deciding whether to make any ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The presidents of Toyota Motor Corp and Honda Motor Co Ltd said they have no immediate plans to curb production in Mexico, preferring to wait until after Donald Trump's inauguration as U.S. President this month before deciding whether to make any changes.

headline.main: Toyota, Honda Say No Immediate Plans to Curb Mexico Production
headline.print_headline: Toyota, Honda Say No Immediate Plans to Curb Mexico Production

docs.snippet: Indonesia's security minister said on Thursday the military had not suspended all cooperation with Australia, contradicting a  military spokesman who said "all forms of cooperation" had been suspended....
docs.lead_paragraph: Indonesia's security minister said on Thursday the military had not suspended all cooperation with Australia, contradicting a  military spokesman who said "all forms of cooperation" had been suspended.

headline.main: Indonesia Has Only Suspended Language Program With Australia: Minister
headline.print_headline: Indonesia Has Only Suspended Language Program With Australia: Minister
